intro: Hibiscus fuscus subsp. naivashensis, commonly known as the Naivasha hibiscus, is a perennial shrub native to Kenya. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Hibiscus fuscus subsp. naivashensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in local habitats.
